entry.title: Clarification on “Manage Memo Record 2.0” and Bank Account Opening Balance Behavior
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

According to the SAP Help Portal, the “FI – Bank Account Balance (Deprecated)” template has been deprecated, and SAP now recommends using the “Manage Memo Record 2.0” app to import the initial bank account balance.

Ref : FI - Bank account balance (deprecated) | SAP Help Portal

I have tried entering the bank accoount balance using the Manage Memo Record 2.0 app.
After the upload, the amount correctly appears in the Cash Flow Analyzer app for the respective bank account, which indicates the memo record is recognized by the system.

However, when I subsequently created the first bank statement in the system, the amount entered via Manage Memo Record 2.0 does not appear as the opening balance for that bank account in the statement.

Could anyone please clarify:

  1. Why the amount recorded via Manage Memo Record 2.0 is not reflected as the opening balance in the first bank statement?

Thank you very much for your guidance and support.

entry.title: EU Triangular Trading workaround for intercompany invoice
entry.content:
Hi experts!

We have the following scenario in regards of triangular trading for which we need a solution for the intercompany invoices:

We order products in company code XX01 (Danish entity) with an external supplier SUP01 in Czech Republic. We want the products to be delivered to our 3PL distribution center in a different company code XX02 (German entity). Therefore we would have two invoices related to the same PO:

  • The supplier SUP01 should invoice company code XX01 and deliver the goods to company code XX02
  • And then we would need intercompany billing to happen between XX01 and XX02 company codes for these products. (were XX1 is acting as the "supplier" and XX02 is acting as the "buyer")

How could we setup such scenario? Has anyone had a similar situation?

Best regards,

Natalie

entry.title: Query on Accounting Principle Config
entry.content:
HI Team,

We are working on a requirement in CFIN where the source system has local GAAP and source system uses local currency as Group Currency. The requirement is to make the company code live in CFIN target system from source system. Target CFIN uses USGAAP with USD as Group Currency. 

What is the best approach to replicate the entries, as we will have difference accounting principles in source and target systems respectively configured.

Thank You,

SS

entry.title: Linkage of debit memo to original sales order
entry.content:
Dear all,

i have a hopefully short question: Assuming there was a sales process via sales order 1 to Customer A. The invoice and billing document have been created and the the materials have been shipped. 

Now you need to create a debit memo because the material price increased and you need to charge it further to the customer A. So you create a debit memo with reference to the origin invoice which is related to sales order 1 . Again, billing document and accounting documents have been created. BUT: There is no linkage between Sales Order 1 and the debit memo as far as i can see. Indeed through the relationship browser you see, that there is a relation but the value flow is not linked. So i cant find a fiori or report where i see the debit memo which increases the margin to the sales order. 

I cannot add the sales order manually while creating the debit memo. The only think i can think of is to extend profitability segment with sales order and sales order item which will be entered manually. 

Any thoughts from anyone would be helpful! 

 

Thank you!

entry.title: FAP_PP085 - F110 - No account symbol assigned to payment method
entry.content:
Solution:

1. SM30: V_T033I_EBST

Account symbol + Description + SIP relevant (X)

2. SM30: V_T042Z_AD

Country + Payment method + Account symbol

3. SPRO

Financial Accounting - Bank Accounting - Business Transactions - Payment Transactions - Electronic Bank Statement - Make Global Settings for Electronic Bank Statement - Assign Accounts to Account Symbol

Account symbol + Acc. mod. + Currency + GL account

entry.title: Automated mass updates for Asset

• Division

Currently, the transaction code AS02 allows updates to these fields, but requires processing each asset individually. We are therefore seeking a more efficient solution that would enable automated mass updates.

Thank you in advance for your assistance.

Regards,

Dr. Aymen

entry.title: Think Twice: Customizations That Break Your Integration
entry.content:
When you build data integrations between applications, small details are very important. If you miss them, you might need to rebuild parts of the integration later, which costs time and money.

One common case is when a team asks the client to make custom changes in their system to help sync the data. This might work in the short term, but it can also bring risks if you don’t think it through.

Before you suggest or require such changes, ask yourself:

  1. Will this work for all clients, or just a few?
  2. Does it require an extra license?
  3. Can the client do it themselves, or will they need outside help (for example, a vendor)?
  4. Is it supported in every version of the app?
  5. Could this setting be removed or changed later in the app?

Why this matters:

  1. Scalability –> integrations should work for many clients, not only special cases.
  2. Maintainability –> customizations can break after upgrades and create extra work.
  3. Risk reduction –> planning early helps avoid broken syncs and unhappy clients.

By asking these questions up front, you can save a lot of rework and keep integrations stable in the long run.

entry.title: Planned Depreciation for Following Month Showing Double the Expected Amount
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

After performing a fixed asset migration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition) for asset transfer during the fiscal year, I noticed that the planned ordinary depreciation for the following month (e.g., period 10 – October 2025) is double the expected amount.

The worksheet that I used in the Fixed Asset - Posting template is "Posting Key", "Posted Value", "Transaction Header", "Transaction Item"

Here are the key details of the migrated asset:

  • Capitalization Date: 28-Feb-2025

  • Transfer (Cut-off) Date: 30-Sep-2025

  • Useful Life: 24 months

  • Depreciation Key: Straight line to zero

  • Acquisition Value: 300,000 

  • Accumulated Depreciation (Mar–Sep): 87,500 (7 months × 12,500)

  • Expected monthly depreciation: 12,500 (***Which should also apply for following depreciation period)

However, the Planned Depreciation for Period 10 is shown as 25,000 instead of 12,500.

Could you please explain what might cause the system to display double planned depreciation for the first period after migration?

Thank you in advance.

Best regards,
HY

SAP S/4HANA Finance

entry.title: Request for Guidance on Entering ‘Physical Location’ Data for Fixed Assets in SAP
entry.content:
Dear Team,

We are currently working on updating the Physical Location information for our fixed assets in SAP. We would appreciate your guidance or suggestions on the best way to enter and manage this data.

Here are the details of our situation:

  •            We have approximately 3,000 fixed asset records.
  •            Each fixed asset (FA) card may represent one or more units.
  •            Each unit can be associated with up to 40 different physical locations.

Could you please advise on the following:

  1. What are the recommended options or fields in SAP to capture multiple physical locations for a single FA?
  2. Are there any best practices or configuration settings we should consider to ensure accurate reporting and easy maintenance?

 

Thank you in advance for your support.

entry.title: SAP MDG FI: Node XXX is not located within the hierarchy
entry.content:
Hi SCN Community,

I hope you are all doing well.

While performing operations on SAP MDG Finance Data Loads (Cost and Profit Center Hierarchy), I encountered an error during File Upload – Step 04 (Check & Execute):

"Node XXX is not located within hierarchy."

Interestingly, this cost hierarchy already exists in the system for the given edition, but it is not visible under Display Master Data: Cost Center Group hierarchy.

Here’s what I have already checked:

  • In Steps 1 to 3 of File Upload, all parameters were evaluated and assigned correctly.
  • The variant settings appear fine.
  • The hierarchy structure in the system matches the Excel file.

I’m unsure what might be causing this issue. Could anyone please guide me on:

  • What parameters I should re-check or adjust?
  • Possible reasons why the hierarchy is not being recognized at Step 04?
  • Any best practices or troubleshooting steps for this scenario?

Your insights or experiences would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

Best Regards, 
Sandeep Suggu.
